items.title: Add vim/emacs keyboard navigation to selector
items.description:
Add vim-style (Ctrl+J/K) and emacs-style (Ctrl+N/P) keyboard navigation to the session selector, matching fzf conventions.

Keybindings:
- Ctrl+J: Move selection down
- Ctrl+K: Move selection up
- Ctrl+N: Move selection down
- Ctrl+P: Move selection up

Existing arrow key navigation remains unchanged.

items.title: Fix tmux colors - match Savvy AI design
items.description:
Issue: tmux colors are inverted from intended design.

Current:
- Main interface background: dark gray (inherited from terminal)
- Footer/status line: colour232 (near-black #050505)
- Visible border present

Target (match savvyai.dev):
- Main interface: pure black (colour16)
- Footer/status line: dark gray (colour235 - matches Savvy AI navbar)
- Footer text: colour240 on dark gray
- No borders (pane-border-status off)

Changes made:
1. status-style: bg=colour232 â†’ bg=colour235
2. window-style: added bg=colour16 (pure black pane background)
3. pane-border-status: set to off

items.title: New tmux sessions lack configured styling and vi-mode
items.description:
Bug: Running `p .` creates a new tmux session, but it launches with stock/unconfigured tmux instead of the styled, vi-mode configured session specified in ADR-002 and ADR-005.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Run: p . (from any directory)
2. Observe: tmux session created with default green status bar

Expected Behavior:
- Color-agnostic status bar (muted gray on default background per ADR-005)
- Vi-style copy mode bindings (v for selection, y for copy per ADR-002)
- Git branch displayed in status bar

Actual Behavior:
- Stock tmux green status bar
- No custom styling or bindings

Root Cause:
- execute.go passes -f /dev/null correctly (disables user config)
- BUT no runtime configuration injection happens after session creation
- The status bar styling and vi-mode bindings from ADR-002/005 are never applied

Environment: macOS Darwin 25.3.0, main branch

items.title: Session Discovery and Selection
items.description: E-001: Session Discovery and Selection - Core epic for listing and selecting existing tmux sessions.

items.title: Session Creation From Directory
items.description: E-002: Session Creation From Directory - Core epic for creating new tmux sessions from CDPATH-discovered directories.

items.title: tmux Execution and Injection Model
items.description: E-003: tmux Execution and Injection Model - Core epic for tmux invocation with -f /dev/null and minimal injected defaults.

items.title: Failure Handling and Messaging
items.description: E-004: Failure Handling and Messaging - Core epic for explicit error messages when CDPATH is missing.

items.title: Drill-down Navigation
items.description: E-005: Drill-down Navigation - Epic for interactive subdirectory navigation before session creation.

items.title: List all existing tmux sessions
items.description:
US-001: As a user, I can see all existing tmux sessions when running `p`.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Given tmux has active sessions
- When `p` is invoked
- Then all sessions are listed by name
- And no directories are required to be present

items.title: Attach to or switch to selected session
items.description:
US-002: As a user, I can attach to or switch to a selected session.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Given a session is selected
- When the selection is confirmed
- Then tmux attaches to that session
- And if inside tmux, the current client is detached

items.title: Create session from CDPATH directory
items.description:
US-003: As a user, I can create a new tmux session from a directory discovered via CDPATH.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Given CDPATH is set
- And a directory is selected
- When the selection is confirmed
- Then a tmux session is created
- And the session name is derived deterministically

items.title: Collision-free session naming
items.description:
US-004: As a user, I never see a naming collision.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Given two directories normalize to the same base name
- When sessions are created
- Then a stable hash suffix is appended
- And no prompt is shown

items.title: tmux runs without global config
items.description:
US-005: As a user, tmux always runs without global config.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Given any invocation path
- When tmux is launched
- Then `-f /dev/null` is always used

items.title: Vi-style copy mode ergonomics
items.description:
US-006: As a user, copy mode behaves with vi-style ergonomics.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Given copy mode is entered
- When `v` is pressed
- Then selection begins
- And `y` copies and exits copy mode

items.title: Clear error when CDPATH unset
items.description:
US-007: As a user, I receive a clear error when CDPATH is unset.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Given CDPATH is unset or empty
- When `p` is invoked
- Then no directories are listed
- And execution exits with an error message
- And the message explains how to fix CDPATH

items.title: Interactive subdirectory navigation
items.description:
US-008: As a user, I can navigate into subdirectories interactively.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Given a selected directory contains subdirectories
- When the user chooses to drill down
- Then subdirectories are listed
- And navigation depth is user-controlled

items.title: Default window name and status bar styling
items.description:
When a tmux session is started, configure sensible defaults:

1. Name the first window 'home' (or similar generic name)
2. Show the current git branch in the status bar
3. Style the status bar to look nice by default - it's the main aesthetic element in tmux
4. Use color-scheme-agnostic colors that look good on any terminal theme (light or dark)

Constraints:
- Keep it minimal, don't go overboard
- Must work universally without user configuration
- No color scheme switching or customization needed

items.title: Add UI package tests
items.description:
Add unit tests for internal/ui/selector.go.

Current coverage: 0%

The ShowSelector function contains complex logic:
- Navigation stack management
- User input parsing
- Drill-down state machine

Approach:
- Mock stdin for user input scenarios
- Test session selection flow
- Test directory selection flow
- Test drill-down navigation
- Test back navigation (..) handling
- Test invalid input handling

items.title: Add integration tests
items.description:
Add integration tests to verify the full workflow.

Currently untested workflows:
- Session listing + selection
- Directory discovery + session creation
- Drill-down navigation flow
- tmux config injection

Approach:
- Use a test tmux server (or mock tmux commands)
- Create temporary CDPATH directories
- Verify end-to-end behavior

items.title: Add main package tests
items.description:
Add unit tests for main.go.

Current coverage: 0%

The run() function contains CDPATH validation logic that should be tested:
- Empty CDPATH error message
- Error formatting

Approach:
- Test CDPATH validation error message content
- Test error propagation from sub-packages

items.title: Add E2E tests
items.description:
Add end-to-end tests validating complete binary behavior.

Approach:
- Use expect-like tool or pty simulation
- Test actual binary invocation
- Verify user-facing output
- Test interactive selection flow

items.title: README, LICENSE, and module path fixes
items.description:
Chore to commit and PR:

1. Beautified README with badges, features section, installation, usage examples
2. Added MIT LICENSE file
3. Fixed module path from wilmooreiii to wilmoore across go.mod, main.go, and internal/ui/selector.go

items.title: go install @latest fails - no semver tag
items.description:
Bug: `go install github.com/wilmoore/p@latest` fails silently and `which p` returns 'not found'.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Run: go install github.com/wilmoore/p@latest
2. Run: which p
3. Observe: p not found

Root Cause:
No semantic version tags exist on the repository. Go's module system requires at least one vX.Y.Z tag for @latest resolution.

Expected: Binary installed and available in PATH
Actual: go install appears to succeed but module not indexed on pkg.go.dev

Fix: Create v0.1.0 tag and push to GitHub

items.title: Display bug and missing CLI flags
items.description:
Multiple issues:

1. Display Bug (Critical): Sessions appear scattered randomly across the screen instead of in a vertical list when running inside tmux.

2. Missing --version flag: `p --version` doesn't work - no argument parsing exists.

3. Missing --help flag: No usage/help documentation via CLI flag.

4. Missing path argument feature: `p .` or `p /path/to/dir` should start a new session in the specified directory.

5. Missing config propagation: When attaching to existing session, should apply p's tmux configuration.

Steps to Reproduce (display bug):
1. Have multiple tmux sessions running
2. Run `p` from inside tmux
3. Observe: sessions displayed in scattered positions instead of vertical list

Expected: Sessions displayed as vertical list with proper formatting
Actual: Sessions appear at random positions across the terminal
